Unit 1: Te Ao MÄori - Assessment Portfolio & Rubric

Holistic assessment following Y8 Systems comprehensive evaluation model

ğŸŒ¿ Cultural Assessment Philosophy

Mana-enhancing assessment: This portfolio celebrates each student's unique cultural identity and learning journey. Assessment honors different ways of knowing and being, following MÄori values of manaakitanga (caring) and whakatÅhea (unity).

ğŸ“ Portfolio Components (Choose 4 of 6)

Component 1: Personal Whakapapa Presentation

Options: Visual constellation, digital story, oral presentation, creative artwork, written reflection, or multimedia project

Focus: Share your identity and connections in a way that feels authentic to you

Connected Resources: Whakapapa Template, Writers Toolkit PEEL Method, Cultural Assessment Framework

Component 2: Tikanga in Action Documentation

Options: Photo essay, video diary, written observations, interview project, or community service report

Focus: Document how you've observed or practiced tikanga MÄori in real situations

Connected Resources: Tikanga Scenarios, Media Literacy Handout, Environmental Literacy Framework

Component 3: MÄtauranga MÄori Deep Dive

Options: Research project, infographic, teaching resource, podcast episode, or hands-on demonstration

Focus: Explore one area of MÄori knowledge systems that interests you most

Connected Resources: MÄtauranga Inquiry Cards, MÄori Astronomy Handout, Traditional Navigation Mathematics

Component 4: Cultural Bridge-Building Project

Options: Cross-cultural comparison, family interview, community connection, or collaborative artwork

Focus: Show how different cultures (including your own) can learn from Te Ao MÄori

Connected Resources: Treaty of Waitangi Podcast, Economic Justice Deep Dive, Cognitive Biases Handout

Component 5: Contemporary Te Ao MÄori Analysis

Options: Current events analysis, social media study, film/music review, or youth perspective essay

Focus: Explore how Te Ao MÄori perspectives apply to modern issues and youth experiences

Connected Resources: Media Literacy v2, Bastion Point Video Activity, Digital Citizenship Handout

Component 6: Future Whakapapa Visioning

Options: Goal-setting plan, community action proposal, creative writing, or leadership reflection

Focus: Articulate how you want to contribute to your whÄnau, community, and future generations

Connected Resources: Community Action Project Brief, Future Rangatiratanga Unit, Prompt Engineering 101

ğŸ“Š Holistic Assessment Rubric

Assessment Criteria Mana Motuhake
(Exceptional - 4)		 Mana TÅpÅ«
(Proficient - 3)		 Mana Tipu
(Developing - 2)		 Mana Tamariki
(Beginning - 1)
Cultural Understanding & Respect Demonstrates deep, nuanced understanding of Te Ao MÄori concepts. Shows genuine respect and cultural sensitivity. Makes meaningful connections between MÄori and other cultural perspectives. Shows solid understanding of key Te Ao MÄori concepts. Demonstrates appropriate respect and cultural awareness. Makes some connections to other cultures. Shows basic understanding of some Te Ao MÄori concepts. Generally respectful approach. Limited connections to broader cultural contexts. Shows minimal understanding of Te Ao MÄori concepts. Needs support to demonstrate cultural respect. Little evidence of broader cultural connections.
Personal Connection & Authenticity Portfolio deeply reflects student's authentic identity and experiences. Strong personal connections to learning. Vulnerable and honest sharing where appropriate. Portfolio reflects student's identity with some depth. Good personal connections to learning. Appropriate level of personal sharing. Portfolio shows some personal connection to learning. Basic reflection on identity and experiences. Limited personal sharing. Portfolio shows minimal personal connection. Little reflection on identity. Very limited personal sharing or engagement.
Critical Thinking & Analysis Demonstrates sophisticated analysis and synthesis of ideas. Makes complex connections between concepts. Shows original thinking and insight. Shows good analytical thinking. Makes clear connections between ideas. Demonstrates understanding through examples and explanations. Shows some analytical thinking. Makes basic connections between ideas. Demonstrates partial understanding of concepts. Shows limited analytical thinking. Minimal connections between ideas. Basic understanding needs development.
Communication & Presentation Outstanding communication skills across chosen formats. Clear, engaging, and culturally appropriate presentation. Excellent use of Te Reo MÄori where appropriate. Good communication skills. Clear and appropriate presentation. Some use of Te Reo MÄori or cultural protocols. Adequate communication skills. Generally clear presentation. Limited use of cultural elements. Basic communication skills. Unclear or incomplete presentation. Minimal cultural integration.
Integration & Synthesis Exceptional integration of multiple resources and learning experiences. Shows deep understanding of connections across different knowledge systems. Good integration of several resources and experiences. Shows understanding of connections between different learning areas. Some integration of resources and experiences. Basic understanding of connections between concepts. Limited integration of resources. Minimal understanding of connections between different learning areas.

ğŸŒŸ Culturally Responsive Feedback Framework

Mana Recognition

Acknowledge the unique mana (spiritual power) each student brings to their learning

Growth Mindset

Focus on ako (learning journey) rather than just achievement outcomes

Cultural Validation

Honor all cultural backgrounds while deepening Te Ao MÄori understanding

Next Steps

Provide clear, actionable guidance for continued cultural learning
